content:
Some social and emotional data that could be useful for a social worker in this situation include:

* The individual's level of impulse control and ability to regulate their emotions and reactions
* Their level of respect for authority and peers
* Their ability to communicate effectively and understand others
* Their willingness to follow directions and complete tasks as assigned
* Any underlying mental health issues or challenges that may be contributing to their behavior
* The individual's level of frustration or anger that may be contributing to their behavior
* Any past experiences or trauma that may be contributing to their behavior
* The individual's level of self-awareness and ability to reflect on their actions and behaviors
* Any social or emotional support systems they may have in place to help them manage their behavior.
